newsitem.title: FINLAND: Valmet sees clearly improved 1996 profit.
newsitem.headline: Valmet sees clearly improved 1996 profit.

text.p: Finnish paper machine maker Valmet Oy said on Tuesday it expected group full-year 1996 profit to improve clearly on 1995.

"The good performance at the beginning of the year, and the consistently strong order backlog, are expected to contribute to clearly improved results for the full year," Valmet said in a statement with its January-August results.
In 1995, Valmet's profit after financial items was 637 million markka.
"The existing order backlog also indicates a positive outlook for the company in 1997," Valmet said.
"The level of interest in new investments has continued low in North America and Europe," Valmet said, referring to the pulp and paper industry.
Investment activity had "remained at a good level" in Asia, it added.
At the end of August, Valmet's Paper and Board Machines division's order backlog stood at 8.1 billion markka. At end-April, the division's order backlog was 7.8 billion markka.
